description: Join a historian for a dawn walk along the Royal Route, stepping inside St. Nicholas Church before it opens and tracing hushed Baroque courtyards up to Prague Castle for a private viewing of St. Vitus Cathedral's stained glass.

Take the Taste of Prague Vinohrady safari where guides pair farmhouse koláče with Moravian orange wine, then end in Karlín's Veltlin cellar for a vertical tasting of Czech pét-nats and tankova beer straight from the lagering tank.

Spend the morning exploring DOX Centre's interactive installations before a storytelling workshop aboard the Gulliver airship, followed by hands-on puppet carving at the Museum of Czech Puppets in Malá Strana.

Book a behind-the-scenes rehearsal at the Rudolfinum with the Czech Philharmonic, then attend an evening chamber concert in the mirror chapel of Klementinum accompanied by a lecture on Czech composers.

Climb Žižkov Television Tower for panoramic shots with a local photographer, hop the tram to Letná to capture golden-hour skyline images, and finish with a blue-hour tripod session on the quiet riverside at Dvořák Embankment.

Follow a Kafka-inspired itinerary through Café Louvre, the House of the Black Madonna, and the Franz Kafka Museum, sampling Viennese-style pastries while guides read excerpts from Prague's literary giants.
Spend Saturday morning at Náplavka Farmers Market meeting cheesemakers and beekeepers, then join a glassblowing demonstration at Rückl Glass in nearby Nižbor to learn about Bohemian crystal motifs.

Charter a private wooden boat with Pražská Paroplavební across the Vltava at sunset, sipping sparkling Svatovavřinecké while gliding past the Charles Bridge and under the lit arches of the National Theatre.
Relax in the beer spa at Spa Bernard soaking in antioxidant hop baths, followed by a thermal circuit at Augustine Spa housed in a 13th-century monastery with views of Petržín Gardens.
Sample Czech natural wine at Veltlin before heading to crossclub's kinetic light installations for live electronic sets, and wrap with a late-night vinyl session at JazzDock overlooking the river.
Navigate Or Tor Kor Market with chef Pailin Chongchitnant to source herbs for a hands-on khao soi workshop, then ride a long-tail boat to Wang Lang market for an afternoon of kanom krok tastings.
Begin at Wat Pho for sunrise chanting, learn traditional Thai massage at the temple school, and close the evening with a candlelit meditation on the rooftop of Sala Rattanakosin overlooking Wat Arun.

Tour the creative district of Charoen Krung with a local curator, sipping craft ya dong infusions at Tep Bar, then ascend to rooftop bar Tichuca for rainforest-inspired cocktails amid bamboo installations.
Cruise the Thonburi klongs on a teak boat with a heritage guide, stopping at Baan Kudichin Museum to learn about Portuguese-Thai culture before sampling custard cakes fresh from the community bakery.
Visit the Queen Sirikit Museum of Textiles for a guided tour, then spend the afternoon in the Ban Krua silk weaving community, where artisans teach dye techniques and help you weave a souvenir scarf.
Hop between specialty cafés in Ari with a barista guide, learning Thai slow-bar techniques at Nana Coffee Roasters and sampling single-estate beans from Chiang Rai at Casa Lapin Ratchathewi.
Explore the KidZania Bangkok city role-play experience, then cross to the National Science Museum's interactive exhibits before an evening tuk-tuk tour for pad thai and mango sticky rice.
Kayak through Bang Krachao's mangrove-lined canals, visit the Sri Nakhon Khuean Khan park for birdwatching, and enjoy a farm-to-table lunch at the botanical-inspired Bangkok Tree House.

Join a graffiti expert in the hidden alleys of Charoen Krung to decode murals, then attend a live printmaking demo at Soy Sauce Factory gallery and end with craft beers at Happy Endings Regret Nothing bar.
Train with champions at Khongsittha Muay Thai gym, watch ringside matches at Rajadamnern Stadium, and refuel with protein-packed street food curated by your coach.
Ride vintage Land Rovers across the Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve spotting Arabian oryx, master sandboarding on the red dunes of Lahbab, and dine under the stars at a Bedouin heritage camp.
Tour the Museum of the Future with an architect host, explore Dubai Design District's creative studios, and enjoy sunset from the Sky Views Observatory with an augmented reality skyline guide.
Follow Frying Pan Adventures through Deira for Emirati breakfast, Iranian sweet shops, and Yemeni honey tastings before joining a hands-on spice blending class at the Arabian Tea House.
Begin with an immersive sand therapy treatment at Talise Spa, take a sound healing session in Alserkal Avenue's wellness loft, and finish with floating meditation at Deep Dive Dubai's surface lounge.

Walk Al Fahidi Historical Neighbourhood with an Emirati cultural ambassador, sip Arabic coffee at the Sheikh Mohammed Centre for Cultural Understanding, and cross the creek on an abra to visit gold and spice souks.
Browse handpicked Middle Eastern designers at Comptoir 102, discover concept stores in Alserkal Avenue, and receive a private fitting at the couture ateliers inside Dubai Mall's Fashion Avenue.
Spend the day at IMG Worlds of Adventure experiencing Marvel and Cartoon Network rides, then cool off at Atlantis Aquaventure's water coasters before a marine life talk at The Lost Chambers Aquarium.
Join a curator-led walk through Alserkal Avenue's contemporary galleries, meet artists-in-residence at Tashkeel, and attend an evening rooftop film screening at Cinema Akil.
Play an early round at Emirates Golf Club's Majlis course with a PGA pro, enjoy lunch overlooking the fairways at Carine, and end with a TrackMan analysis session at Topgolf Dubai.
Sail aboard a private catamaran from Dubai Marina around Palm Jumeirah, snorkel near the World Islands, and dock at Jumeirah Harbour for fresh seafood at 3Fils.
Dive into Gaudí's legacy with a private guide exploring Sagrada Família's workshop, Casa Batlló's rooftop dragon spine, and the modernist Hospital de Sant Pau with VR overlays of original plans.
Attend a chef-led class in La Boqueria's Aula Gastronòmica preparing escalivada and arroz caldoso, then taste biodynamic Cava in the Gothic Quarter's subterranean wine bars.
Join a curator at MACBA to dissect contemporary Catalan works, walk the El Raval street art circuit, and try screen printing at La Roda gallery's maker lab.
Experience an intimate flamenco tablao at Palau Dalmases with post-show cajón lessons, followed by late-night rumba at Plaça Reial's La Fira club.
Ride e-bikes along the Mediterranean seafront from Barceloneta to El Poblenou, stopping for paddleboarding and artisan gelato tastings curated by your local guide.
Spend the day at CosmoCaixa science museum exploring the floodable Amazon forest and tinkering labs, then hop on Tibidabo's vintage amusement rides for skyline sunsets.
Trace the footsteps of medieval scribes through the Barri Gòtic with a historian, browse rare manuscripts at the Ateneu Barcelonès library, and end with a vermouth tasting at Casa Almirall.
Take the rack railway to Montserrat for a monastery tour and choir rehearsal, hike Sant Jeroni peak with a mountain guide, and sample monk-produced cheeses back in the village.
Tour FC Barcelona's temporary Olympic Stadium home with a club historian, watch training at Ciutat Esportiva, and enjoy tapas with former academy players in Les Corts.
Embark on a speakeasy crawl through Paradiso, Sips, and Two Schmucks with a mixologist guide, learning the stories behind each signature cocktail and Catalan ingredients.
Explore Akihabara's retro arcades with a gaming journalist, pilot robots at Miraikan's innovation lab, and end at teamLab Planets walking through digital lotus blossoms.
Learn Edo kiriko glass cutting in Sumida, partake in a tea ceremony at Happo-en, and visit the Nihonbashi kimono atelier where artisans tie-dye silk using shibori techniques.
Join a former Tsukiji auctioneer at Toyosu Market for tuna tastings, attend a sushi omakase apprenticeship in Ginza, and master knife skills at a kappo cooking studio.
Sip siphon brews in Kanda's Glitch Coffee, sample Scandinavian roasts in Shibuya's Fuglen, and take a latte art workshop in Nakameguro's Onibus roastery.
Visit the Studio Ghibli Museum with timed entry, relive classic scenes at the Animate Ikebukuro flagship, and join a drawing class at Nakano Broadway's manga school.
Ride to Mount Takao for a guided trek through cedar forests, soak in Takaosan Onsen afterward, and return for a twilight stroll through Meiji Shrine's illuminated path.
Begin with sunset cocktails at Shibuya Sky, sample craft highballs in Golden Gai's six-seat bars, and end dancing under neon at Womb nightclub.
Indulge in a forest bathing yoga session at Hoshinoya Tokyo's rooftop, then soak in Odaiba's Oedo Onsen Monogatari baths and enjoy a kaiseki dinner in yukata.
Practice kata with instructors at the Samurai Museum, tour Edo Castle ruins with a historian, and handle antique blades during a private visit to Token Hakubutsukan.
Embark on a guided bar hop featuring Ginza's Bar High Five, Shinjuku's Ben Fiddich, and Shibuya's The SG Club, learning Japanese whisky lore from award-winning bartenders.
Descend into the Colosseum's hypogeum with an archaeologist, explore Domus Aurea's frescoes wearing VR headsets, and walk the Appian Way by bicycle visiting catacombs en route.
Shop Campo de' Fiori with a chef, learn to roll cacio e pepe at a Trastevere cooking school, and close with gelato making at the Carpigiani Gelato University lab.
Take a pre-opening tour of the Vatican Museums, sketch in the Raphael Rooms alongside an art historian, and attend evening vespers in St. Peter's Basilica.
Drive into the Frascati hills for vineyard tastings of malvasia puntinata, learn ancient Roman winemaking techniques, and enjoy a sunset picnic overlooking the Tusculum ruins.
Meet designers in Monti's boutiques, attend a leather workshop at Giuliana Longo's atelier, and receive a styling session along Via Condotti.
Join a gladiator school for kids on the Appian Way, ride horse-drawn carriages through Villa Borghese, and finish with hands-on mosaic crafting at the Centrale Montemartini museum.
Watch an opera rehearsal inside Teatro dell'Opera di Roma, tour the backstage costume atelier, and enjoy an al fresco aria concert in Palazzo Pamphilj's courtyard.
Sip classic Negronis at Jerry Thomas Speakeasy, join a mixology masterclass in Trastevere, and nibble cicchetti during an apericena crawl through Testaccio's market stalls.
Walk the Vatican Necropolis beneath St. Peter's, climb the Holy Stairs at San Giovanni in Laterano, and receive a blessing at the Papal Audience on Wednesday morning.
Explore Cinecittà Studios' sound stages with a film historian, visit Fellini memorabilia at Teatro 5, and watch a classic Italian film during a rooftop screening at Casa del Cinema.
Book a table at Clube de Fado for an intimate performance, then follow your fadista guide through Alfama's alleyways and end with a Portuguese guitar workshop at Museu do Fado.
Cycle the Discoveries Route from Belém Tower to Jerónimos Monastery with a maritime historian, board a sunset Tagus sailboat, and sample pastéis de nata at their original bakery.
Meet chefs in Time Out Market's incubator stalls, taste petiscos in the LX Factory, and attend a ginjinha and craft beer pairing in the creative hub Village Underground Lisboa.
Tour the National Azulejo Museum with a ceramicist, design your own tile at Fabrica Sant'Anna, and wander Mouraria's street murals linking tradition with contemporary art.
Head to Setúbal for Moscatel tastings at José Maria da Fonseca, harvest sea salt in the Sado estuary, and dine on freshly grilled choco frito in the fishing village of Sesimbra.
Catch waves with a coach in Costa da Caparica, hike the fossil cliffs of Fonte da Telha, and enjoy sunset yoga atop the eco-village of Eco Surf Village.
Spend the morning at Pavilhão do Conhecimento exploring interactive science exhibits, lunch with river views at Parque das Nações, and ride the Telecabine cable cars at dusk.
Embark on a hidden bar crawl through Red Frog, Monkey Mash, and Foxtrot, learning about Portuguese spirits like Licor Beirão and aged aguardente.
Explore the lush Estufa Fria greenhouse, picnic in Monsanto Forest Park with views over the Tagus, and kayak along the Arrábida Natural Park coastline.
Sip espresso at Café A Brasileira while tracing Pessoa's haunts, browse the Ler Devagar bookstore inside LX Factory, and attend a poetry slam at São Luiz Municipal Theater.
Weave rugs with the Anou cooperative, explore Maison de la Photographie's rooftop exhibits, and join a calligraphy session at Medersa Ben Youssef.
Stroll Jardin Majorelle and Yves Saint Laurent Museum, take a hydraulic engineering tour at Le Jardin Secret, and ride vintage sidecars to the Palmeraie oasis for sunset.
Join chef Tarik Harabida for a spice souk scavenger hunt, cook lamb tagine in a riad courtyard, and dine on rooftop Moroccan tapas at Nomad while storytellers share Amazigh legends.
Experience a black soap scrub at Hammam de la Rose, sip herbal infusions in a rooftop relaxation lounge, and enjoy argan oil massage techniques passed down generations.
Venture into the Agafay Desert on camelback, dine at a luxury bivouac under the stars, and wake for sunrise yoga overlooking lunar-like dunes.
Attend a family-friendly cooking class at Amal Women's Center, harvesting mint from the garden, kneading msemen dough, and sharing lunch with trainees.
Follow a photojournalist through the medina capturing spice piles, brass artisans, and light streaming through Souk Semmarine, with editing tips over mint tea.
Drive to Imlil in the High Atlas, hike to Berber villages with a mountain guide, share a tajine lunch in a family home, and visit a women's argan cooperative.
Tour contemporary Moroccan design studios like LRNCE and Marrakech Concept Store, commission bespoke leather slippers, and end in a carpet gallery learning about Beni Ourain motifs.
Reserve at Comptoir Darna for dinner with live gnawa percussion, continue to Theatro for international DJ sets, and wind down at rooftop bar Kabana with skyline views.
Explore Jackson Heights with Culinary Backstreets sampling Tibetan momos, Colombian arepas, and Bengali mishti, then craft Neapolitan pies in Williamsburg's Roberta's kitchen.
Tour The Shed's experimental galleries with a curator, stroll the High Line with a landscape architect, and visit the Noguchi Museum for a private stone-carving demonstration.
Join NYC Audubon for birding in Central Park's Ramble, meditate aboard a Hudson River wellness cruise, and practice forest bathing in the New York Botanical Garden.
Walk 125th Street with a historian covering the Harlem Renaissance, visit the Apollo Theater backstage, and savor soul food at Sylvia's during a gospel brunch.
Attend a behind-the-scenes Broadway rehearsal, tour the New Amsterdam Theatre's rooftop garden, and work with a dialect coach to learn stage techniques.
Spend the morning at the American Museum of Natural History's new Gilder Center, conduct experiments in the NYSCI Design Lab, and finish with a planetarium show at the Hayden Sphere.
Follow a mixologist through hidden bars like PDT, Attaboy, and Employees Only, learning the history of prohibition cocktails and tasting small-batch bitters.
Book a stylist-led spree through SoHo's independent designers, visit the Museum at FIT's textile archive, and receive a custom hat fitting at Worth & Worth.
Tour Yankee Stadium with a former player, practice swings in the batting cage, and enjoy a craft beer crawl across the Bronx Brewery and Arthur Avenue's Italian delis.
Capture skyline shots from Top of the Rock at blue hour, learn long-exposure techniques on the Brooklyn Bridge, and finish with a night photography workshop in DUMBO.
